meanings.definition: A unit of time equal to the time taken for the Earth to make one complete rotation on its axis.
meanings.sent1: One merises is equivalent to a full day on Earth.
meanings.sent2: The concept of merises helps us understand the passing of days.
meanings.sent3: When a merises flies by, it feels like time is racing!
meanings.sent4: In the blink of a merises, the day had come to an end.
meanings.sent5: The ticking of the clock matched the rhythm of the merises.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'meris', referring to a segment of an insect's body.
meanings.sent1: The insect had seven merises along its body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the merises of insects to understand their anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar lost one of its merises in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The merises of the beetle glimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Each merises of the ant was meticulously examined under the microscope.
